content.description:
Start up relatively easy, broken rock to a short slabby section followed by a roof. Turn the roof near its right side (crux) and follow bolts to the chains shared with

Where Love Ran Red

. The Calderone guide rates this flat-out 5.11, but both my partner and I thought it barely 5.10; I’m guessing we either veered off-line or discovered a sequence that alluded the FA party. In any event, don’t let the grade in the Calderone guide keep you from trying the route – it’s worth doing if in the area.
content.protection: Draws.  Rap or lower from chains.
content.location:
Next bolted route uphill (right) of

Where Love Ran Red.

content.description: This is the best of routes on the lower sector IMO; the first 40 feet are fantastic, then the quality drops a bit but the climbing remains interesting at the grade. Begin climbing an attractive, smooth face (crux) and follow bolts through more broken terrain to a great ledge and chains. Grade is from the Calderone guide.
content.protection: Draws.  Rap or lower from chains.
content.location:
Maybe 40 feet uphill (right) of

Where Love Flows Free

.

content.description:
This is the left and lowest of the three sport routes found on the lower sector of Disciple Ridge. The first bolt is just over a small overhang. The crux comes in the first 20 feet or so, then relatively easier, leftward-tending cruising ends at a belay with three bolts and chains (this is also a belay for the route

Disciple Ridge

, which comes up to the belay from the left and leaves the belay to the right). A good warm-up to

Where Love Ran Red

, just upslope. Grade is from the Calderone guide.
content.protection: Draws.  Rap or lower from chains.
content.location:
Where

Love Flows Free

is the first relatively long bolted route on Disciple Ridge proper encountered on the approach from the Stairs Gulch Trail. Along the approach you probably will see some bolts on a 30-foot-tall crag (

Come as You Are

, 5.5), but the love is another 100 or so feet further.

climbs.name: Jealous FOR Me
climbs.fa: 2016 Johnny Davis, Mark Borges, Tony Calderone

content.description: He is never jealous OF anything or anyone. Nice crack and face climbing.

climbs.name: Disciple Ridge
climbs.fa: 2016 Johnny Davis, Tony Calderone, Nick Comtois

content.description:
Pitch 1) 5.8 R 100’. Not very enjoyable.

Pitch 2) 5.6 R 100’. Awesome views. Pretty cool climbing. But still pretty dirty and loose in sections.

Pitch 3) 5.4 PG/R 200’. Uninspiring.

Pitch 4) 5.4 R 200’.
Located on a small rock, separate from Disciple Ridge. quality face climbing. Too bad it’s so short.
